name: VOOL
description: An object-oriented and pictoral/visual programming language inspired by Logo.  A prototype interpreter and development environment was made for a research project by Emily M. Black and Thierno Fall of Naval Postgraduate School, Monterey, California around 1994.

commands.description: Moves the specified turtle to the specified coordinates without drawing a line.  It roughly translates to jumpTo in WebLogo.
Initializes the pen to start of the drawing.  Roughly translates to 'home' in WebLogo
Puts the pen down for the specified turtle.  Roughly translates to WebLogo's penDown.
Lifts the pen for the specified turtle.  Roughly translates to WebLogo's penUp.
Draws a regular polygon with the specified side length and number of sides.  Roughly translates to WebLogo's regularPolygon.
Turns the turtle's heading to the left the specified amount.  Roughly translates to WebLogo's left.
Turns the turtle's heading to the right the specified amount.  Roughly translates to WebLogo's right.
Turns the turtle's heading to the true compass direction in degrees.  It roughly translates to setHeading in WebLogo.
